item.title: Alexander add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "Writing is a way of talking without being interrupted." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Find out the reason that commands you to write; see whether it has spread its roots into the very depth of your heart; confess to yourself you would have to die if you were forbidden to write." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "For one human being to love another human being: that is perhaps the most difficult task that has been given to us, the ultimate, the final problem and proof, the work for which all other work is merely preparation." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Yet, no matter how deeply I go down into myself, my God is dark, and like a webbing made of a hundred roots that drink in silence." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I am circling around God, around the ancient tower, and I have been circling for a thousand years, and I still don't know if I am a falcon, or a storm, or a great song." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Everything is blooming most recklessly; if it were voices instead of colors, there would be an unbelievable shrieking into the heart of the night." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The necessary thing is after all but this; solitude, great inner solitude. Going into oneself for hours meeting no one - this one must be able to attain." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I hold this to be the highest task of a bond between two people: that each should stand guard over the solitude of the other." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Things aren't all so tangible and sayable as people would usually have us believe; most experiences are unsayable, they happen in a space that no word has ever entered, and more unsayable than all other things are works of art, those mysterious existences, whose life endures beside our own small, transitory life" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I am the rest between two notes which are somehow always in discord." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?" -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "There are causes worth dying for, but none worth killing for." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "When the soul suffers too much, it develops a taste for misfortune." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Let all of life be an unfettered howl." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "The more powerful and original a mind, the more it will incline towards the religion of solitude." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Alexander add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood
